notesStmt.note: Se'adyah ben David ben Zekharyah ben Amram al-Akhlufi; inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 254r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Former Prophets: Hebrew text with ordinary punctuation and Targum with simple superlinear punctuation in alternate verses; with masorah magna and parva. Maḥberet ha-tigan is prefixed.

collation.p: 25 quires of mostly 10 leaves each. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first and the last page. Leaves numbered with Hebrew letters.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated. Yosef ben Zekharyah ben Me'oded ben Se'adyah al-Kaisi; inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 254r, with an uncertain date of 1900. The same person also punctuated the whole manuscript.

decoDesc.decoNote: Two full pages filled with micrographic designs.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Joshua-Kings, with Targum. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1471.'
